title: Adding ETH to non-funded validators using the original deposit_data JSON
body:
When I set up 30 validators on launchpad I had enough GöETH for only 3 validators so I funded only those at first. after I got more GöETH I launched the launchpad website and skipped all the way to the point of dropping the depoist_data JSON file into the browser, at that point it showed me the list of validators for funding - I was not aware that those that have already been funded are also listed as they all show a "start" status - so I ended up with a validator with 64 ETH unintentionally. In the main-net this would have been pretty frustrating - not sure if thats a bug or by design, but I would definitely show those validators as "funded" with an option to "add funds" for example, or hide them altogether, but if thats not an option then I would at least have a visible alert saying "PLEASE NOTE THIS LIST MAY ALREADY INCLUDE FUNDED VALIDATORS" 

On that note, now after alll validators have taken a hit last week, how can I send them another ETH to be at 32+ balance for max earnings? Launchpad can only send 32 ETH and no option to send 1 for example. Is there a way to do that? 

Thanks!
